meta.hint:
Homophones are words that sound the same but have different spellings and meanings.
Example - My friends and I buy lunch at school. Buy means to pay for something.
Example - Then we all eat together by the big tree. By means near.
Example - We say bye to each other when the bell rings. Bye is short for goodbye.
meta.question: Homophones are words that sound the same but have different spellings and meanings. Example - My friends and I buy lunch at school. Buy means to pay for something. Then we all eat together by the big tree. By means near.We say bye to each other when the bell rings. Bye is short for goodbye.

content.description:
Complete the sentence with the correct homophone.
Charles and Frank are neighbors, and _____ friends.

Complete the sentence with the correct homophone.
I _____ a nice place for picnic.

Complete the sentence with the correct homophone.
She was sick with the _____

Complete the sentence with the correct homophone.
The __ landed on those bush.
